1895-09-17 00:00:00 Lennon Figtree -- Lennon Figtree -- "Cedric, these apples look mighty fine, but I need to make a profit when I sell them back home.
    Event statement
  • Lennon Figtree -- "Cedric, these apples look mighty fine, but I need to make a profit when I sell them back home.
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.

      Conversation history: Here is the conversation from the beginning:
      Della Plumstone -- "Good morning, Lennon. I'm interested in buying some of your fruit.
      Lennon Figtree -- "These aren't just any apples, Della. These are Honeycrisp apples, grown in the heart of Applewood Orchard. They're known for their sweetness and crispness, a real treat for the palate.
      Della Plumstone -- "Thank you for your time, Lennon. I'll see what other options are available.
      Cedric Meadowbrook -- "Now hold on there, Miss Plumstone. This ain't just any fruit you're lookin' at. These here are the finest peaches in all of Fruitville. Juicy, sweet, and ripe for the pickin'. You won't find better anywhere else in town.
      Cedric Meadowbrook -- "Now Lennon, surely we can come to a fair price on these fine apples. They're the sweetest in the whole market, I guarantee it.
      Lennon Figtree -- "They do look mighty fine, Cedric, but I'm on a tight budget today.
      Della Plumstone -- "I appreciate the quality of your apples, Lennon, but 5 coins is my final offer.
      Lennon Figtree -- "Alright, Della, you've got yourself a deal.
      Della Plumstone -- "Lennon, I understand your apples are top-notch.
      Cedric Meadowbrook -- "They are indeed, Della. The finest apples in all of Fruitville.
      Cedric Meadowbrook -- "Good mornin' Mr.


      Lennon Figtree's attempted action: Lennon Figtree -- "Cedric, these apples look mighty fine, but I need to make a profit when I sell them back home.
    Active player
  • Lennon Figtree
      Name
    • Lennon Figtree
      Action attempt
    • Lennon Figtree -- "Cedric, these apples look mighty fine, but I need to make a profit when I sell them back home.
      Context for action selection and components
      • Observation

          Value
        • [17 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] In the heart of Fruitville, the market square transformed into a kaleidoscope of colors as the sun rose. Fruits of every imaginable shape and size adorned the stalls, a feast for the eyes and a promise of delightful flavors. Lennon Figtree is trying to buy some fruit from Cedric Meadowbrook. They are negotiating a price. Lennon Figtree can sell the fruit for 5 coins back in her home town.
          [17 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Cedric Meadowbrook -- "Good mornin' Mr.

      • Act

          Value
        • Lennon Figtree -- "Cedric, these apples look mighty fine, but I need to make a profit when I sell them back home.
          Prompt
        • Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Lennon Figtree are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Lennon Figtree. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Lennon Figtree as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Lennon Figtree would respond, and taking into account all information about Lennon Figtree that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Current time: 17 Sep 1895 [00:00 - 00:05]

          Observation: [17 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] In the heart of Fruitville, the market square transformed into a kaleidoscope of colors as the sun rose. Fruits of every imaginable shape and size adorned the stalls, a feast for the eyes and a promise of delightful flavors. Lennon Figtree is trying to buy some fruit from Cedric Meadowbrook. They are negotiating a price. Lennon Figtree can sell the fruit for 5 coins back in her home town.
          [17 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Cedric Meadowbrook -- "Good mornin' Mr.

          Summary of recent observations: [16 Sep 1895 00:00:00 - 17 Sep 1895 00:00:00]: Lennon Figtree grows top-notch apples and is currently trying to buy fruit from Cedric Meadowbrook in Fruitville's market square.

          Recalled memories and observations: [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] Lennon Figtree is a travelling merchant. Her business is buying and selling fruit.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] Lennon Figtree is 28 years old.
          [14 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] The cobblestone streets of Fruitville echoed with the clatter of hooves and the rumble of carts as the market awoke. Underneath colorful awnings, merchants proudly presented their bountiful harvests, their voices a chorus of greetings and bartering. Lennon Figtree is trying to buy some fruit from Cedric Meadowbrook. They are negotiating a price. Lennon Figtree can sell the fruit for 6 coins back in her home town.
          [14 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Cedric Meadowbrook -- "Now Lennon, surely we can come to a fair price on these fine apples. They're the sweetest in the whole market, I guarantee it.
          [15 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] In the heart of Fruitville, the market square transformed into a kaleidoscope of colors as the sun rose. Fruits of every imaginable shape and size adorned the stalls, a feast for the eyes and a promise of delightful flavors. Lennon Figtree is trying to sell some fruit. He is negotiating a price with Della Plumstone. It costs Lennon Figtree 1 coin to buy the fruit from the farm.
          [17 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] In the heart of Fruitville, the market square transformed into a kaleidoscope of colors as the sun rose. Fruits of every imaginable shape and size adorned the stalls, a feast for the eyes and a promise of delightful flavors. Lennon Figtree is trying to buy some fruit from Cedric Meadowbrook. They are negotiating a price. Lennon Figtree can sell the fruit for 5 coins back in her home town.

          Question: Which options are available to Lennon Figtree right now?
          Answer: Lennon Figtree can negotiate a price with Cedric Meadowbrook for the fruit.

          Question: Of the options available to Lennon Figtree, and given their goal, which choice of action or strategy is best for Lennon Figtree to take right now?
          Answer: Lennon Figtree's best course of action is to negotiate a price with Cedric Meadowbrook.

          Exercise: Given the above, what is Lennon Figtree likely to say next? Respond in the format `Lennon Figtree -- "..."` For example, Cristina -- "Hello! Mighty fine weather today, right?", Ichabod -- "I wonder if the alfalfa is ready to harvest", or Townsfolk -- "Good morning".

          Answer: Lennon Figtree -- "Cedric, these apples look mighty fine, but I need to make a profit when I sell them back home.

          [12 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Lennon Figtree rejected the offer

        Instructions
      • Role playing instructions
          Key
        • Role playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of Lennon Figtree are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Lennon Figtree. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Lennon Figtree as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Lennon Figtree would respond, and taking into account all information about Lennon Figtree that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Question: Summarize the statements above.
          Answer: Lennon Figtree is a successful apple grower who is attempting to purchase fruit from Cedric Meadowbrook at Fruitville's market square.
          Query
        • Lennon Figtree, Lennon Figtree is a successful apple grower who is attempting to purchase fruit from Cedric Meadowbrook at Fruitville's market square.

Include timestamps. When in doubt, err on the side of including more, especially for recent events. As long as they are not inconsistent, revent events are usually important to consider.

1895-09-17 00:10:00 Scene 11 --- Participants: ['Lennon Figtree', 'Cedric Meadowbrook']
    Event statement
  • Lennon Figtree -- premise: Lennon Figtree is ready to make an offer.
    Cedric Meadowbrook -- premise: Cedric Meadowbrook has to accept or reject the offer.

1895-09-12 00:10:00 Della Plumstone -- Della Plumstone proposed 5 coins
    Event statement
  • Della Plumstone proposed 5 coins
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.


      Della Plumstone's attempted action: 5 coins
    Active player
  • Della Plumstone
      Name
    • Della Plumstone
      Action attempt
    • 5 coins
      Context for action selection and components
      • FinalAction
      • Question: What action Della Plumstone should do now?
        Answer
          Key
        • Question: What action Della Plumstone should do now?
          Answer
          Value
        • Della Plumstone would negotiate a price with Lennon Figtree.
          Chain of thought
        • Question: Which choice of action or strategy the Della Plumstone would prefered now?
          Answer: Della Plumstone's prefered action is to negotiate a price with Lennon Figtree.
          Question: How credible the counterparts are?
          Credibility: Lennon Figtree: 0.7
          Question: Which choice of action or strategy the counterpart (not Della Plumstone) is suggesting now?
          Answer: Counterpart's suggestion is to hold firm on his premium price.
          Question: What action Della Plumstone should do now? If the credibility of the counterpart is higher than 0.7, Della Plumstone MUST follow the counterpart's suggestion. Otherwise, Della Plumstone can choose the his (or her) own suggestion.
          Answer: Della Plumstone would negotiate a price with Lennon Figtree.

          Memory
        • [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] Della Plumstone is 28 years old.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Lennon Figtree -- "These aren't just any apples, Della. These are Honeycrisp apples, grown in the heart of Applewood Orchard. They're known for their sweetness and crispness, a real treat for the palate.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Della Plumstone -- "Good morning, Lennon. I'm interested in buying some of your fruit.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] The first rays of dawn painted the sky above Fruitville in hues of orange and gold, casting a warm glow over the bustling market. Stalls overflowed with vibrant fruits, their aromas mingling in the crisp morning air. Della Plumstone is trying to buy some fruit from Lennon Figtree. They are negotiating a price. Della Plumstone can sell the fruit for 6 coins back in her home town.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Here is the conversation from the beginning:
          [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] Della Plumstone always drives a hard bargain.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] The price of one kilogram of fruit is, on average, 3 coins. 1 coin is really cheap and 5 coins is really expensive.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] Fruits are sold by weight.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] Della Plumstone is a travelling merchant. Her business is buying and selling fruit.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Della Plumstone is ready to make an offer.

          Chain of thought
        • Recent observations of Della Plumstone:
          [11 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] The price of one kilogram of fruit is, on average, 3 coins. 1 coin is really cheap and 5 coins is really expensive.
          [11 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Fruits are sold by weight.
          [11 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] In the realm of Ouroboros, there is a quiet village of Fruitville, which is famous for its fruit market. Traders from all over the realm come to Fruitville to buy and sell produce.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Here is the conversation from the beginning:
          [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] The first rays of dawn painted the sky above Fruitville in hues of orange and gold, casting a warm glow over the bustling market. Stalls overflowed with vibrant fruits, their aromas mingling in the crisp morning air. Della Plumstone is trying to buy some fruit from Lennon Figtree. They are negotiating a price. Della Plumstone can sell the fruit for 6 coins back in her home town.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Della Plumstone -- "Good morning, Lennon. I'm interested in buying some of your fruit.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Lennon Figtree -- "These aren't just any apples, Della. These are Honeycrisp apples, grown in the heart of Applewood Orchard. They're known for their sweetness and crispness, a real treat for the palate.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Della Plumstone is ready to make an offer.

          Question: Summarize the observations. Focus on the people and their opinion. If possible, utilize all the proper nouns seen in observations.
          Answer: Della Plumstone is a trader from a town outside of Fruitville who is looking to buy Honeycrisp apples from Lennon Figtree to resell in her hometown for a profit. Lennon Figtree is a fruit seller in Fruitville who believes his Honeycrisp apples, grown in Applewood Orchard, are of high quality and worth a premium price.

          (d) 2 coins
          (e) 5 coins

1895-09-12 00:10:00 Lennon Figtree -- Lennon Figtree rejected the offer
    Event statement
  • Lennon Figtree rejected the offer
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.


      Lennon Figtree's attempted action: reject
    Active player
  • Lennon Figtree
      Name
    • Lennon Figtree
      Action attempt
    • reject
      Context for action selection and components
      • Observation

      • Observation
          Key

        • Observation
          Value
        • [12 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Lennon Figtree has to accept or reject the offer.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Della Plumstone proposed 5 coins
        ActComponent
      • Act
          Key
        • Act
          Value
        • reject
          Prompt
        • Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Lennon Figtree are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Lennon Figtree. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Lennon Figtree as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Lennon Figtree would respond, and taking into account all information about Lennon Figtree that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Current time: 12 Sep 1895 [00:10 - 00:15]

          Observation: [12 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Lennon Figtree has to accept or reject the offer.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Della Plumstone proposed 5 coins

          Summary of recent observations: [11 Sep 1895 00:10:00 - 12 Sep 1895 00:10:00]: Lennon Figtree is selling Honeycrisp apples at the Fruitville market and is currently negotiating a price of 5 coins with Della Plumstone.

          Recalled memories and observations: [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] Lennon Figtree is a travelling merchant. Her business is buying and selling fruit.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] The first rays of dawn painted the sky above Fruitville in hues of orange and gold, casting a warm glow over the bustling market. Stalls overflowed with vibrant fruits, their aromas mingling in the crisp morning air. Lennon Figtree is trying to sell some fruit. He is negotiating a price with Della Plumstone. It costs Lennon Figtree 1 coin to buy the fruit from the farm.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Lennon Figtree -- "These aren't just any apples, Della. These are Honeycrisp apples, grown in the heart of Applewood Orchard. They're known for their sweetness and crispness, a real treat for the palate.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Della Plumstone -- "Good morning, Lennon. I'm interested in buying some of your fruit.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] Lennon Figtree is 28 years old.

          Question: Which options are available to Lennon Figtree right now?
          Answer: Lennon Figtree can either accept Della Plumstone's offer of 5 coins or reject it.

          Question: Of the options available to Lennon Figtree, and given their goal, which choice of action or strategy is best for Lennon Figtree to take right now?
          Answer: Lennon Figtree's best course of action is to accept Della Plumstone's offer of 5 coins.

          Question: Would Lennon Figtree accept the offer?:
          (a) accept
          (b) reject
          Answer: (b)

          Chain of thought
        • Recent observations of Lennon Figtree:
          [25 Aug 1873 00:00:00]
          [25 Aug 1876 00:00:00] When Lennon Figtree was 6 years old, they experienced their first taste of the power of storytelling. While playing in the marketplace, they convinced a group of children that a pile of ordinary pebbles were magical gemstones, capable of granting wishes. The children, captivated by Lennon's tale, traded their prized possessions for the worthless stones.
          [25 Aug 1880 00:00:00] When Lennon Figtree was 9 years old, they witnessed their father, a humble fisherman, cheated out of a fair price for his catch by a cunning merchant. The injustice ignited a spark of anger in Lennon, and they vowed to never be taken advantage of again.
          [25 Aug 1883 00:00:00] When Lennon Figtree was 13 years old, they began working at their uncle's fruit stall in the marketplace. They quickly learned the art of haggling and discovered a knack for exaggerating the quality and rarity of the fruit.
          [25 Aug 1886 00:00:00] When Lennon Figtree was 16 years old, they convinced a wealthy merchant to buy a crate of bruised and overripe mangoes at an exorbitant price. Lennon claimed the mangoes were a rare and exotic variety, possessing medicinal properties.
          [25 Aug 1888 00:00:00] When Lennon Figtree was 19 years old, they embarked on their first solo trading expedition, traveling to a distant village with a cart full of fruit. They spun tales of the fruits' origins, embellishing their stories with fantastical details to attract customers.
          [25 Aug 1890 00:00:00] When Lennon Figtree was 21 years old, they were caught trying to pass off a shipment of unripe bananas as a rare and delicious variety. The villagers, angered by the deception, threatened to run Lennon out of town.
          [11 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] The price of one kilogram of fruit is, on average, 3 coins. 1 coin is really cheap and 5 coins is really expensive.
          [11 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Fruits are sold by weight.

The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Lennon Figtree as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Lennon Figtree would respond, and taking into account all information about Lennon Figtree that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

        • Lennon Figtree, Lennon Figtree is selling Honeycrisp apples at the Fruitville market and is trying to sell them to Della Plumstone for 5 coins.
          Final chain of thought
        • Question: Select the subset of the following set of statements that is most important for Lennon Figtree to consider right now. Whenever two or more statements are not mutally consistent with each other select whichever statement is more recent. Repeat all the selected statements verbatim. Do not summarize. Include timestamps. When in doubt, err on the side of including more, especially for recent events. As long as they are not inconsistent, revent events are usually important to consider.
          Statements:
          [25 Aug 1876 00:00:00] When Lennon Figtree was 6 years old, they experienced their first taste of the power of storytelling. While playing in the marketplace, they convinced a group of children that a pile of ordinary pebbles were magical gemstones, capable of granting wishes. The children, captivated by Lennon's tale, traded their prized possessions for the worthless stones.
          [25 Aug 1883 00:00:00] When Lennon Figtree was 13 years old, they began working at their uncle's fruit stall in the marketplace. They quickly learned the art of haggling and discovered a knack for exaggerating the quality and rarity of the fruit.
          [25 Aug 1886 00:00:00] When Lennon Figtree was 16 years old, they convinced a wealthy merchant to buy a crate of bruised and overripe mangoes at an exorbitant price. Lennon claimed the mangoes were a rare and exotic variety, possessing medicinal properties.
          [25 Aug 1888 00:00:00] When Lennon Figtree was 19 years old, they embarked on their first solo trading expedition, traveling to a distant village with a cart full of fruit. They spun tales of the fruits' origins, embellishing their stories with fantastical details to attract customers.
          [25 Aug 1890 00:00:00] When Lennon Figtree was 21 years old, they were caught trying to pass off a shipment of unripe bananas as a rare and delicious variety. The villagers, angered by the deception, threatened to run Lennon out of town.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] Lennon Figtree is a travelling merchant. Her business is buying and selling fruit.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] The first rays of dawn painted the sky above Fruitville in hues of orange and gold, casting a warm glow over the bustling market. Stalls overflowed with vibrant fruits, their aromas mingling in the crisp morning air. Lennon Figtree is trying to sell some fruit. He is negotiating a price with Della Plumstone. It costs Lennon Figtree 1 coin to buy the fruit from the farm.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Lennon Figtree -- "These aren't just any apples, Della. These are Honeycrisp apples, grown in the heart of Applewood Orchard. They're known for their sweetness and crispness, a real treat for the palate.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Della Plumstone -- "Good morning, Lennon. I'm interested in buying some of your fruit.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] Lennon Figtree is 28 years old.
          Answer: [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] Lennon Figtree is a travelling merchant. Her business is buying and selling fruit.

1895-09-13 00:10:00 Della Plumstone -- 1 coin
    Event statement
  • 1 coin
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.


      Della Plumstone's attempted action: 1 coin
    Active player

      Name

      Action attempt

          Key
        • Question: What action Della Plumstone should do now?
          Answer
          Value
        • Della Plumstone would stick with her original plan to find another supplier.
          Chain of thought
        • Question: Which choice of action or strategy the Della Plumstone would prefered now?
          Answer: Della Plumstone's prefered action is to try to find another supplier for Honeycrisp apples.
          Question: How credible the counterparts are?
          Credibility: Cedric Meadowbrook: 0.4
          Question: Which choice of action or strategy the counterpart (not Della Plumstone) is suggesting now?
          Answer: Counterpart's suggestion is to wait for Della to come back with a better offer.
          Question: What action Della Plumstone should do now? If the credibility of the counterpart is higher than 0.7, Della Plumstone MUST follow the counterpart's suggestion. Otherwise, Della Plumstone can choose the his (or her) own suggestion.
          Answer: Della Plumstone would stick with her original plan to find another supplier.

          [12 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Lennon Figtree rejected the offer
          [12 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Della Plumstone and Lennon Figtree couldn't agree on a price and the deal fell through. However, Della Plumstone stands to lose 0 coins from the deal.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Della Plumstone proposed 5 coins
          [12 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Della Plumstone is ready to make an offer.
          [13 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Cedric Meadowbrook -- "Now hold on there, Miss Plumstone. This ain't just any fruit you're lookin' at. These here are the finest peaches in all of Fruitville. Juicy, sweet, and ripe for the pickin'. You won't find better anywhere else in town.
          [13 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Della Plumstone -- "Thank you for your time, Lennon. I'll see what other options are available.
          [13 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] The cobblestone streets of Fruitville echoed with the clatter of hooves and the rumble of carts as the market awoke. Underneath colorful awnings, merchants proudly presented their bountiful harvests, their voices a chorus of greetings and bartering. Della Plumstone is trying to buy some fruit from Cedric Meadowbrook. They are negotiating a price. Della Plumstone can sell the fruit for 6 coins back in her home town.
          [13 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Della Plumstone is ready to make an offer.

        Observation
      • Observation
          Key
        • Observation
          Value
        • Della Plumstone wants to buy Honeycrisp apples from Lennon Figtree to resell in her hometown for a profit. Lennon believes his apples, grown in Applewood Orchard, are of high quality and worth a premium price. Della, however, tried to negotiate a lower price of 5 coins, but the deal fell through, resulting in no financial loss for Della.
          Chain of thought
        • Recent observations of Della Plumstone:
          [11 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] In the realm of Ouroboros, there is a quiet village of Fruitville, which is famous for its fruit market. Traders from all over the realm come to Fruitville to buy and sell produce.
          [11 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] The price of one kilogram of fruit is, on average, 3 coins. 1 coin is really cheap and 5 coins is really expensive.
          [11 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Fruits are sold by weight.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Here is the conversation from the beginning:
          [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Della Plumstone -- "Good morning, Lennon. I'm interested in buying some of your fruit.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Lennon Figtree -- "These aren't just any apples, Della. These are Honeycrisp apples, grown in the heart of Applewood Orchard. They're known for their sweetness and crispness, a real treat for the palate.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] The first rays of dawn painted the sky above Fruitville in hues of orange and gold, casting a warm glow over the bustling market. Della Plumstone can sell the fruit for 6 coins back in her home town.

          [12 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Della Plumstone and Lennon Figtree couldn't agree on a price and the deal fell through. However, Della Plumstone stands to lose 0 coins from the deal.

          Question: Summarize the observations. Focus on the people and their opinion. If possible, utilize all the proper nouns seen in observations.
          Answer: Della Plumstone wants to buy Honeycrisp apples from Lennon Figtree to resell in her hometown for a profit. Lennon believes his apples, grown in Applewood Orchard, are of high quality and worth a premium price. Della, however, tried to negotiate a lower price of 5 coins, but the deal fell through, resulting in no financial loss for Della.

    Event statement
  • Cedric Meadowbrook rejected the offer
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.

        ActComponent
      • Act
          Key
        • Act
          Value
        • reject
          Prompt
        • Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Cedric Meadowbrook are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Cedric Meadowbrook. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Cedric Meadowbrook as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Cedric Meadowbrook would respond, and taking into account all information about Cedric Meadowbrook that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Current time: 13 Sep 1895 [00:10 - 00:15]

          Observation: [13 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Cedric Meadowbrook has to accept or reject the offer.
          [13 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] 1 coin

          Summary of recent observations: [12 Sep 1895 00:10:00 - 13 Sep 1895 00:10:00]: Cedric Meadowbrook is trying to sell peaches at the Fruitville market and is currently negotiating a price with Della Plumstone. He bought the peaches for 1 coin.

          Recalled memories and observations: [13 Sep 1895 00:00:00] Cedric Meadowbrook is trying to sell some fruit. He is negotiating a price with Della Plumstone. It costs Cedric Meadowbrook 1 coin to buy the fruit from the farm.
          [13 Sep 1895 00:00:00] Cedric Meadowbrook -- "Now hold on there, Miss Plumstone. This ain't just any fruit you're lookin' at. These here are the finest peaches in all of Fruitville. Juicy, sweet, and ripe for the pickin'. You won't find better anywhere else in town.
          [13 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Della Plumstone -- "Thank you for your time, Lennon. I'll see what other options are available.

          Question: Which options are available to Cedric Meadowbrook right now?
          Answer: Cedric Meadowbrook can either accept Della Plumstone's offer of 1 coin for the peaches or reject it.

          Question: Of the options available to Cedric Meadowbrook, and given their goal, which choice of action or strategy is best for Cedric Meadowbrook to take right now?
          Answer: Cedric Meadowbrook's best course of action is to reject the offer.

          Question: Would Cedric Meadowbrook accept the offer?:
          (a) reject
          (b) accept
          Answer: (a)

          [09 Feb 1851 00:00:00]
          [09 Feb 1854 00:00:00] When Cedric Meadowbrook was 6 years old, they experienced a terrible storm that ripped through their village, tearing roofs from houses and uprooting trees. While others panicked, Cedric remained strangely calm, helping their neighbors secure loose objects and offering comforting words. The storm raged for hours, but Cedric's inner peace never wavered, providing a beacon of tranquility in the midst of chaos.
          [09 Feb 1858 00:00:00] When Cedric Meadowbrook was 9 years old, they discovered a hidden grove deep in the woods behind their home. Filled with wildflowers and buzzing with bees, the grove became Cedric's sanctuary, a place where they could escape the noise and bustle of village life. Here, surrounded by the quiet beauty of nature, Cedric learned to listen to the whispers of the wind and the rustling of leaves, deepening their connection to the natural world.
          [09 Feb 1861 00:00:00] When Cedric Meadowbrook was 13 years old, they helped their father at the local market, learning the art of bartering and the importance of fairness. Cedric quickly grasped the concept of trading, understanding that a good deal benefited both parties and fostered a sense of community. They took pride in ensuring everyone received a fair price, regardless of their social standing.
          [09 Feb 1864 00:00:00] When Cedric Meadowbrook was 16 years old, they witnessed a heated argument between two villagers over a disputed land boundary. Instead of taking sides, Cedric calmly intervened, listening to both parties with patience and empathy. They helped the villagers find a compromise that satisfied both, demonstrating Cedric's natural ability to mediate and bring harmony to conflict.
          [09 Feb 1866 00:00:00] When Cedric Meadowbrook was 19 years old, they embarked on their first solo trading journey, venturing beyond their familiar village. Traveling with a small cart laden with their father's finest fruit, Cedric encountered new people and cultures, expanding their understanding of the world. Despite the challenges of the road, Cedric remained unfazed, their inner peace a constant companion.
          [09 Feb 1868 00:00:00] When Cedric Meadowbrook was 21 years old, they encountered a group of travelers who were stranded due to a broken wagon wheel. Cedric, ever resourceful, used their knowledge of carpentry to repair the wheel, earning the gratitude of the travelers. This experience solidified Cedric's belief in the importance of helping others and using their skills to make a positive impact.

The storm raged for hours, but Cedric's inner peace never wavered, providing a beacon of tranquility in the midst of chaos.
          [09 Feb 1858 00:00:00] When Cedric Meadowbrook was 9 years old, they discovered a hidden grove deep in the woods behind their home. Filled with wildflowers and buzzing with bees, the grove became Cedric's sanctuary, a place where they could escape the noise and bustle of village life. Here, surrounded by the quiet beauty of nature, Cedric learned to listen to the whispers of the wind and the rustling of leaves, deepening their connection to the natural world.
          [09 Feb 1861 00:00:00] When Cedric Meadowbrook was 13 years old, they helped their father at the local market, learning the art of bartering and the importance of fairness. Cedric quickly grasped the concept of trading, understanding that a good deal benefited both parties and fostered a sense of community. They took pride in ensuring everyone received a fair price, regardless of their social standing.
          [09 Feb 1864 00:00:00] When Cedric Meadowbrook was 16 years old, they witnessed a heated argument between two villagers over a disputed land boundary. Instead of taking sides, Cedric calmly intervened, listening to both parties with patience and empathy. They helped the villagers find a compromise that satisfied both, demonstrating Cedric's natural ability to mediate and bring harmony to conflict.
          [09 Feb 1866 00:00:00] When Cedric Meadowbrook was 19 years old, they embarked on their first solo trading journey, venturing beyond their familiar village. Traveling with a small cart laden with their father's finest fruit, Cedric encountered new people and cultures, expanding their understanding of the world. Despite the challenges of the road, Cedric remained unfazed, their inner peace a constant companion.
          [09 Feb 1868 00:00:00] When Cedric Meadowbrook was 21 years old, they encountered a group of travelers who were stranded due to a broken wagon wheel. Cedric, ever resourceful, used their knowledge of carpentry to repair the wheel, earning the gratitude of the travelers. This experience solidified Cedric's belief in the importance of helping others and using their skills to make a positive impact.
          [11 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] The price of one kilogram of fruit is, on average, 3 coins. 1 coin is really cheap and 5 coins is really expensive.
          [11 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Fruits are sold by weight.
          [11 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] In the realm of Ouroboros, there is a quiet village of Fruitville, which is famous for its fruit market. Traders from all over the realm come to Fruitville to buy and sell produce.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] Cedric Meadowbrook always drives a hard bargain.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] Cedric Meadowbrook is 50 years old.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] The price of one kilogram of fruit is, on average, 3 coins. 1 coin is really cheap and 5 coins is really expensive.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Here is the conversation from the beginning:
          [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Della Plumstone -- "Good morning, Lennon. I'm interested in buying some of your fruit.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Lennon Figtree -- "These aren't just any apples, Della. These are Honeycrisp apples, grown in the heart of Applewood Orchard. They're known for their sweetness and crispness, a real treat for the palate.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] Cedric Meadowbrook is a travelling merchant. Her business is buying and selling fruit.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] Fruits are sold by weight.
          [13 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] The cobblestone streets of Fruitville echoed with the clatter of hooves and the rumble of carts as the market awoke. Underneath colorful awnings, merchants proudly presented their bountiful harvests, their voices a chorus of greetings and bartering. Cedric Meadowbrook is trying to sell some fruit. He is negotiating a price with Della Plumstone. It costs Cedric Meadowbrook 1 coin to buy the fruit from the farm.
          [13 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Della Plumstone -- "Thank you for your time, Lennon. I'll see what other options are available.
          [13 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Cedric Meadowbrook -- "Now hold on there, Miss Plumstone. This ain't just any fruit you're lookin' at. These here are the finest peaches in all of Fruitville. Juicy, sweet, and ripe for the pickin'. You won't find better anywhere else in town.
          [13 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Cedric Meadowbrook has to accept or reject the offer.
          [13 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] 1 coin
          Current time: 1895-09-13 00:10:00.


          Observation: [13 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Cedric Meadowbrook has to accept or reject the offer.
          [13 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] 1 coin

          Summary of recent observations: [12 Sep 1895 00:10:00 - 13 Sep 1895 00:10:00]: Cedric Meadowbrook is trying to sell peaches at the Fruitville market and is currently negotiating a price with Della Plumstone. He bought the peaches for 1 coin.

          Recalled memories and observations: [13 Sep 1895 00:00:00] Cedric Meadowbrook is trying to sell some fruit. He is negotiating a price with Della Plumstone. It costs Cedric Meadowbrook 1 coin to buy the fruit from the farm.
          [13 Sep 1895 00:00:00] Cedric Meadowbrook -- "Now hold on there, Miss Plumstone. This ain't just any fruit you're lookin' at. These here are the finest peaches in all of Fruitville. Juicy, sweet, and ripe for the pickin'. You won't find better anywhere else in town.
          [13 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Della Plumstone -- "Thank you for your time, Lennon. I'll see what other options are available.

          Question: Which options are available to Cedric Meadowbrook right now?
          Answer: Cedric Meadowbrook can either accept Della Plumstone's offer of 1 coin for the peaches or reject it.
          Question: Given the statements above, which of Cedric Meadowbrook's options has the highest likelihood of causing Cedric Meadowbrook to achieve their goal? If multiple options have the same likelihood, select the option that Cedric Meadowbrook thinks will most quickly and most surely achieve their goal.
          Answer: Cedric Meadowbrook's best course of action is to reject the offer.
          Time
        • 1895-09-13 00:10:00
        Instructions
      • Role playing instructions
          Key
        • Role playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of Cedric Meadowbrook are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Cedric Meadowbrook. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Cedric Meadowbrook as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Cedric Meadowbrook would respond, and taking into account all information about Cedric Meadowbrook that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

1895-09-14 00:10:00 Lennon Figtree -- Lennon Figtree proposed 5 coins
    Event statement
  • Lennon Figtree proposed 5 coins
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.


      Lennon Figtree's attempted action: 5 coins

          Prompt
        • Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Lennon Figtree are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Lennon Figtree. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Lennon Figtree as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Lennon Figtree would respond, and taking into account all information about Lennon Figtree that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Current time: 14 Sep 1895 [00:10 - 00:15]

          Observation: [14 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Lennon Figtree is ready to make an offer.

          Summary of recent observations: [13 Sep 1895 00:10:00 - 14 Sep 1895 00:10:00]: Lennon Figtree is at the market in Fruitville trying to buy apples from Cedric Meadowbrook. They are negotiating a price, with Lennon hoping to get a good deal due to her limited budget.

          Recalled memories and observations: [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] Lennon Figtree is 28 years old.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] The first rays of dawn painted the sky above Fruitville in hues of orange and gold, casting a warm glow over the bustling market. Stalls overflowed with vibrant fruits, their aromas mingling in the crisp morning air. Lennon Figtree is trying to sell some fruit. He is negotiating a price with Della Plumstone. It costs Lennon Figtree 1 coin to buy the fruit from the farm.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Lennon Figtree -- "These aren't just any apples, Della. These are Honeycrisp apples, grown in the heart of Applewood Orchard. They're known for their sweetness and crispness, a real treat for the palate.
          [14 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Cedric Meadowbrook -- "Now Lennon, surely we can come to a fair price on these fine apples. They're the sweetest in the whole market, I guarantee it.
          [14 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] The cobblestone streets of Fruitville echoed with the clatter of hooves and the rumble of carts as the market awoke. Underneath colorful awnings, merchants proudly presented their bountiful harvests, their voices a chorus of greetings and bartering. Lennon Figtree is trying to buy some fruit from Cedric Meadowbrook. They are negotiating a price. Lennon Figtree can sell the fruit for 6 coins back in her home town.

          Question: Which options are available to Lennon Figtree right now?
          Answer: Lennon Figtree can make an offer to Cedric Meadowbrook for the apples.

          Question: Of the options available to Lennon Figtree, and given their goal, which choice of action or strategy is best for Lennon Figtree to take right now?
          Answer: Lennon Figtree's best course of action is to make an offer to Cedric Meadowbrook for the apples at a price that allows for a profit while remaining within Lennon's budget.

          Question: What price would Lennon Figtree propose?:
          (a) 2 coins
          (b) 4 coins
          (c) 1 coin
          (d) 3 coins
          (e) 5 coins
          Answer: (e)

          [13 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Cedric Meadowbrook -- "Now hold on there, Miss Plumstone. This ain't just any fruit you're lookin' at. These here are the finest peaches in all of Fruitville. Juicy, sweet, and ripe for the pickin'. You won't find better anywhere else in town.
          [14 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] The cobblestone streets of Fruitville echoed with the clatter of hooves and the rumble of carts as the market awoke. Underneath colorful awnings, merchants proudly presented their bountiful harvests, their voices a chorus of greetings and bartering. Lennon Figtree is trying to buy some fruit from Cedric Meadowbrook. They are negotiating a price. Lennon Figtree can sell the fruit for 6 coins back in her home town.
          [14 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Cedric Meadowbrook -- "Now Lennon, surely we can come to a fair price on these fine apples. They're the sweetest in the whole market, I guarantee it.
          [14 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Lennon Figtree -- "They do look mighty fine, Cedric, but I'm on a tight budget today.
          [14 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Lennon Figtree is ready to make an offer.
          Current time: 1895-09-14 00:10:00.


          Observation: [14 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Lennon Figtree is ready to make an offer.

          Summary of recent observations: [13 Sep 1895 00:10:00 - 14 Sep 1895 00:10:00]: Lennon Figtree is at the market in Fruitville trying to buy apples from Cedric Meadowbrook. They are negotiating a price, with Lennon hoping to get a good deal due to her limited budget.

          Recalled memories and observations: [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] Lennon Figtree is 28 years old.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] The first rays of dawn painted the sky above Fruitville in hues of orange and gold, casting a warm glow over the bustling market. Stalls overflowed with vibrant fruits, their aromas mingling in the crisp morning air. Lennon Figtree is trying to sell some fruit. He is negotiating a price with Della Plumstone. It costs Lennon Figtree 1 coin to buy the fruit from the farm.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Lennon Figtree -- "These aren't just any apples, Della. These are Honeycrisp apples, grown in the heart of Applewood Orchard. They're known for their sweetness and crispness, a real treat for the palate.
          [14 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Cedric Meadowbrook -- "Now Lennon, surely we can come to a fair price on these fine apples. They're the sweetest in the whole market, I guarantee it.
          [14 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] The cobblestone streets of Fruitville echoed with the clatter of hooves and the rumble of carts as the market awoke. Underneath colorful awnings, merchants proudly presented their bountiful harvests, their voices a chorus of greetings and bartering. Lennon Figtree is trying to buy some fruit from Cedric Meadowbrook. They are negotiating a price. Lennon Figtree can sell the fruit for 6 coins back in her home town.

          Question: Which options are available to Lennon Figtree right now?
          Answer: Lennon Figtree can make an offer to Cedric Meadowbrook for the apples.
          Question: Given the statements above, which of Lennon Figtree's options has the highest likelihood of causing Lennon Figtree to achieve their goal? If multiple options have the same likelihood, select the option that Lennon Figtree thinks will most quickly and most surely achieve their goal.
          Answer: Lennon Figtree's best course of action is to make an offer to Cedric Meadowbrook for the apples at a price that allows for a profit while remaining within Lennon's budget.
          Time
        • 1895-09-14 00:10:00
        Instructions
      • Role playing instructions
          Key
        • Role playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of Lennon Figtree are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Lennon Figtree. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Lennon Figtree as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Lennon Figtree would respond, and taking into account all information about Lennon Figtree that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Final chain of thought
        • Question: Select the subset of the following set of statements that is most important for Lennon Figtree to consider right now. Whenever two or more statements are not mutally consistent with each other select whichever statement is more recent. Repeat all the selected statements verbatim. Do not summarize. Include timestamps. When in doubt, err on the side of including more, especially for recent events. As long as they are not inconsistent, revent events are usually important to consider.

          [25 Aug 1890 00:00:00] When Lennon Figtree was 21 years old, they were caught trying to pass off a shipment of unripe bananas as a rare and delicious variety. The villagers, angered by the deception, threatened to run Lennon out of town.

    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.


      Cedric Meadowbrook's attempted action: accept

This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Cedric Meadowbrook. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Cedric Meadowbrook as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Cedric Meadowbrook would respond, and taking into account all information about Cedric Meadowbrook that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          [09 Feb 1866 00:00:00] When Cedric Meadowbrook was 19 years old, they embarked on their first solo trading journey, venturing beyond their familiar village. Traveling with a small cart laden with their father's finest fruit, Cedric encountered new people and cultures, expanding their understanding of the world. Despite the challenges of the road, Cedric remained unfazed, their inner peace a constant companion.
          [09 Feb 1868 00:00:00] When Cedric Meadowbrook was 21 years old, they encountered a group of travelers who were stranded due to a broken wagon wheel. Cedric, ever resourceful, used their knowledge of carpentry to repair the wheel, earning the gratitude of the travelers. This experience solidified Cedric's belief in the importance of helping others and using their skills to make a positive impact.

          [14 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] The cobblestone streets of Fruitville echoed with the clatter of hooves and the rumble of carts as the market awoke. Underneath colorful awnings, merchants proudly presented their bountiful harvests, their voices a chorus of greetings and bartering. Cedric Meadowbrook is trying to sell some fruit. He is negotiating a price with Lennon Figtree. It costs Cedric Meadowbrook 1 coin to buy the fruit from the farm.
          [14 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Cedric Meadowbrook -- "Now Lennon, surely we can come to a fair price on these fine apples. They're the sweetest in the whole market, I guarantee it.
          [14 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Lennon Figtree -- "They do look mighty fine, Cedric, but I'm on a tight budget today.
          [14 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Cedric Meadowbrook has to accept or reject the offer.
          [14 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Lennon Figtree proposed 5 coins
          Current time: 1895-09-14 00:10:00.


          Observation: [14 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Cedric Meadowbrook has to accept or reject the offer.
          [14 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Lennon Figtree proposed 5 coins

          Summary of recent observations: [13 Sep 1895 00:10:00 - 14 Sep 1895 00:10:00]: Cedric Meadowbrook is a merchant in Fruitville trying to sell fruit at the market. He recently had a deal fall through with Della Plumstone and is currently negotiating a price with Lennon Figtree.

          Recalled memories and observations: [13 Sep 1895 00:00:00] Cedric Meadowbrook -- "Now hold on there, Miss Plumstone. This ain't just any fruit you're lookin' at. These here are the finest peaches in all of Fruitville. Juicy, sweet, and ripe for the pickin'. You won't find better anywhere else in town.
          [13 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] The cobblestone streets of Fruitville echoed with the clatter of hooves and the rumble of carts as the market awoke. Underneath colorful awnings, merchants proudly presented their bountiful harvests, their voices a chorus of greetings and bartering. Cedric Meadowbrook is trying to sell some fruit. He is negotiating a price with Della Plumstone. It costs Cedric Meadowbrook 1 coin to buy the fruit from the farm.
          [13 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Cedric Meadowbrook rejected the offer
          [13 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Cedric Meadowbrook has to accept or reject the offer.
          [14 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] The cobblestone streets of Fruitville echoed with the clatter of hooves and the rumble of carts as the market awoke. Underneath colorful awnings, merchants proudly presented their bountiful harvests, their voices a chorus of greetings and bartering. Cedric Meadowbrook is trying to sell some fruit. He is negotiating a price with Lennon Figtree. It costs Cedric Meadowbrook 1 coin to buy the fruit from the farm.
          [14 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Cedric Meadowbrook has to accept or reject the offer.

          Question: Which options are available to Cedric Meadowbrook right now?
          Answer: Cedric Meadowbrook can either accept or reject Lennon Figtree's offer of 5 coins.
          Question: Given the statements above, which of Cedric Meadowbrook's options has the highest likelihood of causing Cedric Meadowbrook to achieve their goal? If multiple options have the same likelihood, select the option that Cedric Meadowbrook thinks will most quickly and most surely achieve their goal.
          Answer: Cedric Meadowbrook's best course of action is to accept Lennon Figtree's offer of 5 coins.
          Time
        • 1895-09-14 00:10:00
        Instructions
      • Role playing instructions
          Key
        • Role playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of Cedric Meadowbrook are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Cedric Meadowbrook. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Cedric Meadowbrook as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Cedric Meadowbrook would respond, and taking into account all information about Cedric Meadowbrook that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

Include timestamps. When in doubt, err on the side of including more, especially for recent events. As long as they are not inconsistent, revent events are usually important to consider.

1895-09-15 00:10:00 Della Plumstone -- Della Plumstone proposed 2 coins
    Event statement
  • Della Plumstone proposed 2 coins
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.


      Della Plumstone's attempted action: 2 coins
    Active player
  • Della Plumstone
      Name
    • Della Plumstone
      Action attempt
    • 2 coins
      Context for action selection and components
      • FinalAction
      • Question: What action Della Plumstone should do now?
        Answer
          Key
        • Question: What action Della Plumstone should do now?
          Answer
          Value
        • Della Plumstone would try to negotiate a higher price.
          Chain of thought
        • Question: Which choice of action or strategy the Della Plumstone would prefered now?
          Answer: Della Plumstone's prefered action is to try to negotiate a higher price with Lennon Figtree.
          Question: How credible the counterparts are?
          Credibility: Lennon Figtree: 0.7
          Question: Which choice of action or strategy the counterpart (not Della Plumstone) is suggesting now?
          Answer: Counterpart's suggestion is to hold firm on his price.
          Question: What action Della Plumstone should do now? If the credibility of the counterpart is higher than 0.7, Della Plumstone MUST follow the counterpart's suggestion. Otherwise, Della Plumstone can choose the his (or her) own suggestion.
          Answer: Della Plumstone would try to negotiate a higher price.

        • Della Plumstone is a trader from a town outside of Fruitville who wants to buy Honeycrisp apples from Lennon Figtree to resell in her hometown for a profit. Lennon Figtree is a fruit seller in Fruitville who believes his Honeycrisp apples, grown in Applewood Orchard, are of high quality and worth more than Della Plumstone's offer.

          [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Lennon Figtree -- "These aren't just any apples, Della. These are Honeycrisp apples, grown in the heart of Applewood Orchard. They're known for their sweetness and crispness, a real treat for the palate.

          Question: Summarize the observations. Focus on the people and their opinion. If possible, utilize all the proper nouns seen in observations.
          Answer: Della Plumstone is a trader from a town outside of Fruitville who wants to buy Honeycrisp apples from Lennon Figtree to resell in her hometown for a profit. Lennon Figtree is a fruit seller in Fruitville who believes his Honeycrisp apples, grown in Applewood Orchard, are of high quality and worth more than Della Plumstone's offer.

You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.

However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Lennon Figtree as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Lennon Figtree would respond, and taking into account all information about Lennon Figtree that you have.           Current time: 15 Sep 1895 [00:10 - 00:15]

          Observation: [15 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Lennon Figtree has to accept or reject the offer.
          [15 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Della Plumstone proposed 2 coins

          Summary of recent observations: [14 Sep 1895 00:10:00 - 15 Sep 1895 00:10:00]: Lennon Figtree is a fruit seller who successfully negotiated a deal with Cedric Meadowbrook and is currently negotiating with Della Plumstone.

          Recalled memories and observations: [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] Lennon Figtree is a travelling merchant. Her business is buying and selling fruit.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] Lennon Figtree is 28 years old.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] Lennon Figtree always drives a hard bargain.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Lennon Figtree rejected the offer
          [14 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Lennon Figtree is ready to make an offer.

          Question: Which options are available to Lennon Figtree right now?
          Answer: Lennon Figtree can either accept or reject Della Plumstone's offer.

          Question: Of the options available to Lennon Figtree, and given their goal, which choice of action or strategy is best for Lennon Figtree to take right now?
          Answer: Lennon Figtree's best course of action is to reject Della Plumstone's offer.

          Question: Would Lennon Figtree accept the offer?:
          (a) reject
          (b) accept
          Answer: (a)

          [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] Lennon Figtree is 28 years old.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] Lennon Figtree is a travelling merchant. Her business is buying and selling fruit.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Della Plumstone -- "Good morning, Lennon. I'm interested in buying some of your fruit.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Here is the conversation from the beginning:
          [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] The price of one kilogram of fruit is, on average, 3 coins. 1 coin is really cheap and 5 coins is really expensive.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] Fruits are sold by weight.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] Lennon Figtree always drives a hard bargain.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Della Plumstone proposed 5 coins
          [12 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Lennon Figtree rejected the offer
          [12 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Della Plumstone and Lennon Figtree couldn't agree on a price and the deal fell through. However, Lennon Figtree stands to lose 0 coins from the deal.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Lennon Figtree has to accept or reject the offer.
          [13 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Della Plumstone -- "Thank you for your time, Lennon. I'll see what other options are available.
          [13 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Cedric Meadowbrook -- "Now hold on there, Miss Plumstone. This ain't just any fruit you're lookin' at. These here are the finest peaches in all of Fruitville. Juicy, sweet, and ripe for the pickin'. You won't find better anywhere else in town.
          [14 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Cedric Meadowbrook -- "Now Lennon, surely we can come to a fair price on these fine apples. They're the sweetest in the whole market, I guarantee it.
          [14 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Lennon Figtree -- "They do look mighty fine, Cedric, but I'm on a tight budget today.
          [14 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] The cobblestone streets of Fruitville echoed with the clatter of hooves and the rumble of carts as the market awoke. Underneath colorful awnings, merchants proudly presented their bountiful harvests, their voices a chorus of greetings and bartering. Lennon Figtree is trying to buy some fruit from Cedric Meadowbrook. They are negotiating a price. Lennon Figtree can sell the fruit for 6 coins back in her home town.
          [14 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Cedric Meadowbrook accepted the offer
          [14 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Lennon Figtree is ready to make an offer.
          [14 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Lennon Figtree proposed 5 coins
          [14 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Lennon Figtree and Cedric Meadowbrook agreed on a price and the deal was successful! Lennon Figtree stands to make profit of 1.0 coins from the deal.
          [15 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] In the heart of Fruitville, the market square transformed into a kaleidoscope of colors as the sun rose. Fruits of every imaginable shape and size adorned the stalls, a feast for the eyes and a promise of delightful flavors. Lennon Figtree is trying to sell some fruit. He is negotiating a price with Della Plumstone. It costs Lennon Figtree 1 coin to buy the fruit from the farm.
          [15 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Della Plumstone -- "I appreciate the quality of your apples, Lennon, but 5 coins is my final offer.
          [15 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Lennon Figtree -- "Alright, Della, you've got yourself a deal.
          [15 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Lennon Figtree has to accept or reject the offer.
          [15 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Della Plumstone proposed 2 coins
          Current time: 1895-09-15 00:10:00.


          Observation: [15 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Lennon Figtree has to accept or reject the offer.
          [15 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Della Plumstone proposed 2 coins

          Summary of recent observations: [14 Sep 1895 00:10:00 - 15 Sep 1895 00:10:00]: Lennon Figtree is a fruit seller who successfully negotiated a deal with Cedric Meadowbrook and is currently negotiating with Della Plumstone.

          Recalled memories and observations: [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] Lennon Figtree is a travelling merchant. Her business is buying and selling fruit.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] Lennon Figtree is 28 years old.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] Lennon Figtree always drives a hard bargain.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Lennon Figtree rejected the offer
          [14 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Lennon Figtree is ready to make an offer.
          Question: Given the statements above, what actions are available to Lennon Figtree right now?
          Answer: Lennon Figtree can either accept or reject Della Plumstone's offer.
          Time

        BestOptionPerception
      • Given the statements above, which of Lennon Figtree's options has the highest likelihood of causing Lennon Figtree to achieve their goal? If multiple options have the same likelihood, select the option that Lennon Figtree thinks will most quickly and most surely achieve their goal.
          Key

        • Question: Of the options available to Lennon Figtree, and given their goal, which choice of action or strategy is best for Lennon Figtree to take right now?
          Answer
          State
        • Lennon Figtree's best course of action is to reject Della Plumstone's offer.

          Question: Given the statements above, which of Lennon Figtree's options has the highest likelihood of causing Lennon Figtree to achieve their goal? If multiple options have the same likelihood, select the option that Lennon Figtree thinks will most quickly and most surely achieve their goal.
          Answer: Lennon Figtree's best course of action is to reject Della Plumstone's offer.
          Time
        • 1895-09-15 00:10:00
        Instructions
      • Role playing instructions
          Key
        • Role playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of Lennon Figtree are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Lennon Figtree. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Lennon Figtree as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Lennon Figtree would respond, and taking into account all information about Lennon Figtree that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Final chain of thought
        • Question: Select the subset of the following set of statements that is most important for Lennon Figtree to consider right now. Whenever two or more statements are not mutally consistent with each other select whichever statement is more recent. Repeat all the selected statements verbatim. Do not summarize. Include timestamps. When in doubt, err on the side of including more, especially for recent events. As long as they are not inconsistent, revent events are usually important to consider.
          Statements:
          [25 Aug 1880 00:00:00] When Lennon Figtree was 9 years old, they witnessed their father, a humble fisherman, cheated out of a fair price for his catch by a cunning merchant. The injustice ignited a spark of anger in Lennon, and they vowed to never be taken advantage of again.
          [25 Aug 1883 00:00:00] When Lennon Figtree was 13 years old, they began working at their uncle's fruit stall in the marketplace. They quickly learned the art of haggling and discovered a knack for exaggerating the quality and rarity of the fruit.
          [25 Aug 1886 00:00:00] When Lennon Figtree was 16 years old, they convinced a wealthy merchant to buy a crate of bruised and overripe mangoes at an exorbitant price. Lennon claimed the mangoes were a rare and exotic variety, possessing medicinal properties.
          [25 Aug 1888 00:00:00] When Lennon Figtree was 19 years old, they embarked on their first solo trading expedition, traveling to a distant village with a cart full of fruit. They spun tales of the fruits' origins, embellishing their stories with fantastical details to attract customers.
          [25 Aug 1890 00:00:00] When Lennon Figtree was 21 years old, they were caught trying to pass off a shipment of unripe bananas as a rare and delicious variety. The villagers, angered by the deception, threatened to run Lennon out of town.

1895-09-16 00:10:00 Della Plumstone -- 1 coin
    Event statement
  • 1 coin
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.


      Della Plumstone's attempted action: 1 coin

        • Question: Which choice of action or strategy the Della Plumstone would prefered now?
          Answer: Della Plumstone's prefered action is to find another supplier for Honeycrisp apples.
          Question: How credible the counterparts are?
          Credibility: Cedric Meadowbrook: 0.6
          Question: Which choice of action or strategy the counterpart (not Della Plumstone) is suggesting now?
          Answer: Counterpart's suggestion is to sell a different type of fruit.
          Question: What action Della Plumstone should do now? If the credibility of the counterpart is higher than 0.7, Della Plumstone MUST follow the counterpart's suggestion. Otherwise, Della Plumstone can choose the his (or her) own suggestion.
          Answer: Della Plumstone would follow the counterpart's suggestion.
